nodes.bodyText:
New files just need  (c) 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved
There is no need to add the OpenPlans bit. Same for other files.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText: Do you want the unnecessary openplans lines removed?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText: @jodygarnett do we have to remove them?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText: For new files, yes because they had nothing to do with OpenPlans (it would just make things more complicated to have them there).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText: No requirement to update the dates anymore, we have determined it has no legal value.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-/* (c) 2014 - 2017 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-/* (c) 2014 - 2017 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText: @jodygarnett do we have to revert the dates?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-/* (c) 2014 - 2017 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText:
No value to update the dates (no harm in it either) --> no need to revert.
aside: We do ask that a date be added when a new file is created.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-/* (c) 2014 - 2017 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved
+/* (c) 2014 - 2020 Open Source Geospatial Foundation - all rights reserved

nodes.bodyText:
There is indeed a behavioral change, the previous code was trying to lookup the files using the resource loader even if the string representation had no scheme, this one does not. The following change fixes the specific build failure.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        return uri.getScheme() != null && "file".equalsIgnoreCase(uri.getScheme());
          
          
            
                        return uri.getScheme() == null || "file".equalsIgnoreCase(uri.getScheme());
          
      
    
    
  

I've verified this change makes for a successful build (with all extensions included, -Prelease):
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  06:12 min (Wall Clock)
[INFO] Finished at: 2020-05-06T15:36:28+02:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
@joshfix are you still working on this one?
